intro: Discopleura nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's discopleura, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the western United States, particularly in regions with rocky or sandy soils. Discopleura nuttallii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
